taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Panicum hirticaule J. Presl subsp. hirticaule

bio:treatment.description: Culms 11-70 cm tall, usually simple; nodes usually hirsute. Sheaths hirsute, hairs papillose-based; Blades 3-16 mm wide, rounded basally. Panicles erect. Spikelets 1.9-3.3 mm. Lower paleas less than 1/2 as long as the upper florets. 2n = 18, 36.
bio:treatment.discussion: Panicum hirticaule subsp. hirticaule is the most com-mon of the subspecies, growing throughout the range of the species but occurring more often in arid habitats. It includes P. alatum Zuloaga and Morrone, a recently described species that differs from P. hirticaule subsp. hirticaule by the presence of paired elaiosomes at the base of a slightly stipitate upper floret.
